subject: History
title: The Babington Plot
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Babington Plot usable.

hook.text: A young Catholic nobleman plotted to assassinate Elizabeth I. Walsingham knew about it before it even started.

buildup.text: Anthony Babington organized a conspiracy to free Mary Queen of Scots and murder Elizabeth.

discovery.text: Walsingham's agent posed as a friendly courier. Every coded letter between Mary and Babington was intercepted.

twist.text: Walsingham let the plot develop deliberatelyâ€”he needed Mary's written approval to justify her execution.

climax.text: Mary took the bait, endorsed the assassination in writing, and sealed her own death warrant.

punchline.text: The spy didn't stop the plotâ€”he let it succeed.

quiz.question: Why did Walsingham allow the Babington Plot to continue rather than stopping it?
options: He didn't discover it until too late
He needed Mary's written approval to justify her execution
He wanted to identify all Catholic sympathizers
